snippet: The spread of such games can only threaten the integrity of sports and create more gambling addicts, especially among the young.
abstract: Editorial argues that boom in online fantasy sports runs afoul of 2006 legislation outlawing Internet gambling; worries its rise could compromise integrity of sports, pose addiction risk and lead to wider acceptance of conventional sports gambling; notes that supporters claim games, played only in states where legal, are based on skill, not chance.
lead_paragraph: The spread of such games can only threaten the integrity of sports and create more gambling addicts, especially among the young.

headline.print_headline: Rein In Online Fantasy Sports Gambling
headline.main: Rein In Online Fantasy Sports Gambling
